content:
The preparation of UiO-66-NH2 was according to a modified reported hydrothermal method. In general, HfCl4 (1.7 g, 5.2 mmol) and 2-aminoterephthalic acid (0.906 g, 5 mmol) were added to 50 mL of a mixed solution of deionized water and acetic acid (volume ratio of 3:2). The mixed solution was refluxed at 100 °C in an oil bath for 24 h to yield light yellow solid powders. The products were collected and washed three times with water, which was activated by heating at 80 °C in vacuum for use.

Synthesis of UiO-66-NHSO<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>3</sub>

To a nanocrystal of UiO-66-NH2 (0.38 g, 1.0 mmol) and triethylamine (0.1518 g, 1.5 mmol) in anhydrous dichloromethane (20 mL) at 0 °C was slowly added trifluoromethanesulfonic anhydride (0.3385 g, 1.2 mmol), and then pyridine (0.0791 g, 1.0 mmol) was added dropwise under stirring conditions. The mixture was maintained at 0 °C for 30 min and then reacted at ambient temperature for 72 h. After the reactions, the sample was collected by centrifugation for further use.

Synthesis of UiO-66-NSO<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>3</sub>K (UiOKTFSI)

The potassium salt form of UiO-66-NSO2CF3K was obtained by neutralization. To a suspended solution of UiO-66-NHSO2CF3 (0.512 g, 1.0 mmol) in deionized water (20 mL) was gradually added slightly excessive K2CO3 powder (0.166 g, 1.2 mmol) at room temperature with stirring for 12 h. The sample was obtained by filtration, and washed two times with water and then heated in 80 °C vacuum overnight.

Synthesis of MOF-Based Single-Ion Conductors (UiOLiTFSI)

The UiOLiTFSI was obtained by ion exchange reaction. The UiO-66-NSO2CF3K (0.55 g, 1.0 mmol) was placed into anhydrous CH3CN (20 mL) in a round-bottom flask, to which was gradually added LiClO4 (0.128 g, 1.2 mmol) at room temperature with stirring for 12 h. The product was filtered and washed with anhydrous acetonitrile several times. Then, the sample was ion-exchanged three times by the same method. Finally, the UiOLiTFSI was obtained by drying at 120 °C in vacuum overnight.

Synthesis of LiUiO-66 (UiOLi)

The UiO-66 was prepared according to a reported method. Typically, terephthalic acid (0.83 g, 5 mmol) and HfCl4 (1.6 g, 5 mmol) were dissolved in 40 mL of mixed solution of dimethylformamide (DMF) and formic acid (volume ratio of 9:1). The mixed solution was put into a stainless-steel autoclave and then heated at 120 °C for 48 h. The product was collected and dried in vacuum at 120 °C; then, it was transferred to the acetonitrile solution of 1 M LiClO4 and stirred for 12 h. The LiUiO-66 obtained was filtered and collected, which was dried by heating at 120 °C in vacuum for use.
clean_text:
Experimental Section

Synthesis of UiO-66-NH2 

The preparation of UiO-66-NH2 was according to a modified reported hydrothermal method. In general, HfCl4 (1.7 g, 5.2 mmol) and 2-aminoterephthalic acid (0.906 g, 5 mmol) were added to 50 mL of a mixed solution of deionized water and acetic acid (volume ratio of 3:2). The mixed solution was refluxed at 100 °C in an oil bath for 24 h to yield light yellow solid powders. The products were collected and washed three times with water, which was activated by heating at 80 °C in vacuum for use.

Synthesis of UiO-66-NHSO2CF3 

To a nanocrystal of UiO-66-NH2 (0.38 g, 1.0 mmol) and triethylamine (0.1518 g, 1.5 mmol) in anhydrous dichloromethane (20 mL) at 0 °C was slowly added trifluoromethanesulfonic anhydride (0.3385 g, 1.2 mmol), and then pyridine (0.0791 g, 1.0 mmol) was added dropwise under stirring conditions. The mixture was maintained at 0 °C for 30 min and then reacted at ambient temperature for 72 h. After the reactions, the sample was collected by centrifugation for further use.

Synthesis of UiO-66-NSO2CF3K (UiOKTFSI)

The potassium salt form of UiO-66-NSO2CF3K was obtained by neutralization. To a suspended solution of UiO-66-NHSO2CF3 (0.512 g, 1.0 mmol) in deionized water (20 mL) was gradually added slightly excessive K2CO3 powder (0.166 g, 1.2 mmol) at room temperature with stirring for 12 h. The sample was obtained by filtration, and washed two times with water and then heated in 80 °C vacuum overnight.

Synthesis of MOF-Based Single-Ion Conductors (UiOLiTFSI)

The UiOLiTFSI was obtained by ion exchange reaction. The UiO-66-NSO2CF3K (0.55 g, 1.0 mmol) was placed into anhydrous CH3CN (20 mL) in a round-bottom flask, to which was gradually added LiClO4 (0.128 g, 1.2 mmol) at room temperature with stirring for 12 h. The product was filtered and washed with anhydrous acetonitrile several times. Then, the sample was ion-exchanged three times by the same method. Finally, the UiOLiTFSI was obtained by drying at 120 °C in vacuum overnight.

Synthesis of LiUiO-66 (UiOLi)

The UiO-66 was prepared according to a reported method. Typically, terephthalic acid (0.83 g, 5 mmol) and HfCl4 (1.6 g, 5 mmol) were dissolved in 40 mL of mixed solution of dimethylformamide (DMF) and formic acid (volume ratio of 9:1). The mixed solution was put into a stainless-steel autoclave and then heated at 120 °C for 48 h. The product was collected and dried in vacuum at 120 °C; then, it was transferred to the acetonitrile solution of 1 M LiClO4 and stirred for 12 h. The LiUiO-66 obtained was filtered and collected, which was dried by heating at 120 °C in vacuum for use.
